definition: collision/crash/to crash together/to collide with/to bump into
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident

sentences.english: The bus and the van collided.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽車與客貨車相撞。

sentences.english: Poor Barry stopped a packet when his car was in collision with a lorry.
sentences.chinese: 巴里的車與一輛卡車相撞，可憐的巴里身負重傷。

sentences.english: The sleep spindles may be “colliding” with the sounds and blocking their progress.
sentences.chinese: 睡眠紡錘波可能與聲音“相撞“並阻止噪聲進入。

sentences.english: There was a three-car collision on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 高速公路上發生了一起三車相撞的事故。

sentences.english: Paul was badly injured when his car was in head-on collision with a bus.
sentences.chinese: 保爾的汽車同一輛公共汽車迎頭相撞時，受了重傷。

sentences.english: A baby survived the car collision.
sentences.chinese: 兩車相撞，一個嬰兒活了下來。

sentences.english: One car come, one car go, two car bong-bong, one people die.
sentences.chinese: 兩車相向而行，相撞後一人死亡。

sentences.english: But suddenly his car collided with another one.
sentences.chinese: 但突然他的車同另一輛車相撞了。

sentences.english: All the passengers were killed in the train crash.
sentences.chinese: 在這次火車相撞事故中，所有乘客均遭不幸。

sentences.english: A common juggling problem occurs when two clubs collide in the air.
sentences.chinese: 一個常見的雜耍問題發生時兩傢俱樂部在空中相撞。

sentences.english: The cars telescoped after the train crashed.
sentences.chinese: 火車相撞後，車廂疊擠到一塊兒了。

sentences.english: He was badly injured when his car was in head-on collision with a bus.
sentences.chinese: 他的車和一輛公共汽車迎頭相撞，受了重傷。

sentences.english: The train collided with a car at the level crossing .
sentences.chinese: 火車在平面交叉道口與一輛小汽車相撞。

sentences.english: There was a three-car collision on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 高速公路上發生了一起3車相撞的事故。

sentences.english: The sailing boat fell foul of a motor speedboat in mid-river.
sentences.chinese: 這艘帆船與一條摩托快艇在河中央相撞。

sentences.english: The liner is reported to have been in collision with an oil tanker.
sentences.chinese: 據報道，這艘客輪與一艘油輪相撞。

definition: to strike/to hit/to ram
to collide/collision
to collide/collision
to collide with one another
to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
to tailgate/to hit the car in front as a result of tailgating
accident/CL:樁|桩[zhuang1],起[qi3],次[ci4]
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to smash
to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to escape/to run away/to abscond
to crash (into another car)/(fig.) (of opinions, schedules etc) to clash/(of subject matter) to be the same
to slam (into)/to smash (into)
to knock against/to knock together/to rattle
to scrape one's car against sth/to sideswipe
